message:
update the view gift activity layout

Improved layout for viewing gift details
- new layout scales image to fill width
- new toolbar uses coordinator layout for scroll behavior
- removed FAB; edit icon now on toolbar
- actiity now scrollable
- include contact avatar image, name, and events
- required some refactoring of loaders, as the event date loader
  is used by multiple activities now
- also refactored the profile data loaders
- note that contactId is now passed as arg to fragment to
  load contact data
- rounded corners for image and button

title: Fix #6 - list not refreshed when recipient modified
message:
Fix #6 - list not refreshed when recipient modified

- A notification must be sent to both Uri's, since the id of the recipient is encoded in it.
- We explicitly handle this case during the save action.
- An alternative fix involves modifying the ContentProvider update handler to  use a recipient neutral Uri. This is arguable better but not as safe.

title: Restore data from backup including raw contacts.
message:
Restore data from backup including raw contacts.

- URI matcher support added for contact table to contract class
- content provider supports operations on contacts
- restore raw contacts from db backup
- all data lookups now by gwid

title: Add table for restoring raw contacts from backup
message: Add table for restoring raw contacts from backup

title: Create UUID for each RawContact created and store as SOURCE_ID for synchronization.
message:
Create UUID for each RawContact created and store as SOURCE_ID for synchronization.

- all content provider items are now indexed by the GWID instead of raw contact id
- likewise, table schemas have been updated (gifts, colors, sizes)
- associated Parcelables also now carry the GWID
- change will also better acilitate backup/restore plan and sync

title: Fixed color saturation
message:
Fixed color saturation

Ignore-this: 89d0f4e3262696a6f5a067ab795ddd24

This was done by using a set of steps:

- After setting diffuse material colors, need to switch the color
  model to HSV and turn the saturation up between 0.80 and 1.00
- Need to subdue the bright white background. Set the world horizon
  color value down, 0.65 is good.
- Need to use a Hemi lamp pointing directly at the subject, I put
  it directly behind the camera.
- Camera angle needs to be perpendicular to the subject.

title: Fixed bug where incorrect image rendered when excessive callbacks to bindView were made.
message:
Fixed bug where incorrect image rendered when excessive callbacks to bindView were made.

Found that bindView was getting called excessively for ListView
and suspected this was causing rendering problems when the ImageView
gets recycled from ViewHolder and a new bitmap needs to be displayed.

Learned that it is important to use:
- RelativeLayout (not LinearLayout) to contain ListView (I was)
- use 'match_parent' (not wrap_content) for layout height and width

Chaning the the layout height and width to match_parent was the
miracle fix to both the excessive callbacks to bindView and the
incorrect image rendering on the first list item.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3859556/cursoradapter-calling-bindview-on-every-item
https://androiddiaries.wordpress.com/2012/06/12/relativelayout-listview-lazy-loading-chaos/

Wonder if the new RecylcerView fixes any of these issues?
